actions: Tonifies the Spleen, nourishes Stomach, Lung and Kidney Yin, tonifies Lung Qi and astringes Jing.
With Tian Hua Fen and Ge Gen, for warm febrile disease or Xiao Ke with irritability and thirst.
With Huang Qi, Zhi Mu and Ge Gen, for irritability and thirst from Wasting and Thirsting disorder.
Tonifies Qi and Blood, strengthens the Spleen, raises Spleen and Stomach Yang and generates Body Fluids.
With Shan Yao, Zhi Mu, Ge Gen and Tian Hua Fen, for Wasting and Thirsting with Interior Heat.
Clears Heat, drains Fire from the Lungs and Stomach, nourishes Yin, moistens Dryness, generates Fluids, clears Deficiency Fire and quenches thirst.
Drains Heat, generates Fluids Clears and drains Lung Heat, transforms Phlegm and moistens Lung Dryness.
With Zhi Mu, Ge Gen and Wu Wei Zi, for Wasting and Thirsting disorder and thirst and irritability associated with injured fluids after warm febrile disease.
Strongly reduces Food Stagnation, improves the Spleen's transportive function, astringes Jing and urine and stops enuresis.
Relieves Heat, relieves thirst, generates fluids and raises Spleen Yang.
Astringes leakage of Lung Qi, tonifies the Kidneys, astringes Jing and sweat, generates fluids and tonifies Qi.

syndromes: Wasting and Thirsting Disorder due to Qi and Yin Deficiency
Failure of Primal Qi to ascend

symptoms: Excessive thirst that is not quenched by substantial intake of fluids

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with diabetes due to Yang Ming Fu.
Contraindicated for those with Deficiency of Ming Men Fire.

notes: Qi Deficiency with thirst are the main symptoms for this condition.

more severe Heat with thirst that cannot be quenched
Yin Deficiency with Empty Fire Flaring
diabetes mellitus with cloudy urination, and low back and knee pain and weakness
diabetes mellitus due to Qi and Yin Deficiency
Heart palpitations with a regularly interrupted pulse
